title: Slayer task/Blue dragons

properties.name: description
properties.value:
Blue dragons can be assigned as a slayer task at level 65 combat by higher end Slayer masters after starting Dragon Slayer I.
Blue dragons are found in various caves across Gielinor, most of them have some requirement to access, such as completion of quests, a dusty key or level 70 agility. They attack with melee and dragonfire, thus some protection against it should be considered (the brutal blue dragon also uses magic). Due to their large size, they are usually able to be safespotted with ranged or halberd-like weapons. As dragons they are also weak to dragonbane weapons.

Blue dragons

Blue dragons can be assigned as a slayer task at level 65 combat by higher end Slayer masters after starting Dragon Slayer I. Blue dragons are found in various caves across Gielinor, most of them have some requirement to access, such as completion of quests, a dusty key or level 70 agility. They attack with melee and dragonfire, thus some protection against it should be considered (the brutal blue dragon also uses magic). Due to their large size, they are usually able to be safespotted with ranged or halberd-like weapons. As dragons they are also weak to dragonbane weapons.

Monster Variants[edit | edit source]

Monster Combat level Slayer XP Locations Notes
Baby blue dragon 48 50
  • Corsair Cove Dungeon
  • Isle of Souls Dungeon
  • Taverley Dungeon
  • Weakest variant of blue dragons. Drops only baby dragon bones, but does not use dragonfire. Taverley Dungeon requires a dusty key or level 70 Agility to access, or completion of Dragon Slayer II to access the Corsair Cove Dungeon.
Blue dragon 111 107.6
  • Corsair Cove Dungeon
  • Heroes' Guild basement
  • Isle of Souls Dungeon
  • Ogre Enclave
  • Taverley Dungeon
  • Taverley Dungeon requires a dusty key or level 70 Agility to access.
  • The Heroes' Guild requires completion of Heroes' Quest to access.
  • The Ogre Enclave requires completion of Watchtower to access.
  • The Corsair Cove Dungeon requires completion of Dragon Slayer II to access.
Brutal blue dragon 271 257
  • Catacombs of Kourend
  • A particularly strong variant of blue dragon with an additional magic attack.
Vorkath 392 (732) 460 (750)
  • Ungael
  • An undead boss monster fought during Dragon Slayer II. A stronger version can be fought after completion of the quest.

Location Comparison[edit | edit source]

 This article is currently in the middle of an expansion or major revamping.
The information contained within it should not be considered fully accurate and/or complete. You can help by contributing to it.
Location Maplink Amount Multicombat Cannonable Safespotable Notes
Catacombs of Kourend 2 Brutal dragons No No Yes
Corsair Cove Dungeon 5 Adult dragons, 3 Baby dragons No Yes Yes
  • Requires completion of Dragon Slayer II.
Heroes' Guild basement 1 Adult dragon No Yes Yes
  • Requires completion of Heroes' Quest.
Isle of Souls Dungeon 4 Adult dragons, 3 Baby dragons No Yes Yes
Ogre Enclave 6 Adult dragons No Yes Yes
  • Requires completion of Watchtower.
Taverley Dungeon 9 Adult dragons, 12 Baby dragons No Yes Yes
  • Requires dusty key or level 70 Agility.
  • A Ring of Dueling and the completion of Enlightened Journey allow for fast banking at Castle Wars, followed by a balloon ride right back to Taverley.
Taverley Dungeon (upper level) 12 Adult dragons No Yes Yes
  • Blue dragons can only be killed here while on a Slayer task.
Ungael 1 Vorkath Yes No No
  • Fought once during Dragon Slayer II, and afterwards requires completion of the quest.
  • For more information on fighting Vorkath, see Vorkath/Strategies.

Blue dragons can be assigned as a [[slayer task]] at level 65 [[combat]] by higher end [[Slayer master]]s after starting [[Dragon Slayer I]].
Blue dragons are found in various caves across [[Gielinor]], most of them have some requirement to access, such as completion of [[quest]]s, a [[dusty key]] or level 70 [[agility]]. They attack with [[melee]] and [[dragonfire]], thus some protection against it should be considered (the [[brutal blue dragon]] also uses [[magic]]). Due to their large size, they are usually able to be [[safespot]]ted with [[ranged]] or [[halberd]]-like weapons. As dragons they are also weak to [[dragonbane]] weapons.
